alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 10:39AM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations up to one inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 85 mph. * WHERE...The foothills and plains adjacent to the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains
